gw.plugin.contact

Interface ContactSystemPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DemoContactSystemPlugin

    public interface ContactSystemPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin

    Plugin interface replacement for the older IAddressBookAdapter. Specifies an application interface to the remote contact management system which can be used to retrieve, create, or update contacts.

    Also presents the application API to the properties on Contact (and other entities in the Contact graph) which are mapped between ClaimCenter and the ContactSystem.

    Note that operations that create or update Contacts in the remote contact management system have an optional transaction ID that correlates the change with an existing transaction.

    Note that operations on this plugin return entities that can be committed to the ClaimCenter database by default. If you are searching the ContactSystem or looking for duplicates, you should obtain your plugin implementation class from the ContactSystemPluginAdapter, which returns a plugin whose results will not commit to the ClaimCenter database. If you need to add any of the Contacts returned you can use the ContactSystemUtil#importFromContactSystem() method to get a Contact which can be committed to the ClaimCenter database.

    Since:
    ClaimCenter 8.0

    • Method Detail

      • createContact

        ContactCreateResult createContact(Contact contact)
        Adds a local Contact to the contact management system, subject to the given approval authority.
        Parameters:
        contact - The local contact
        Returns:
        the addressbookUID of the created contact or null if create failed

      • createContact

        ContactCreateResult createContact(Contact contact,
                                  java.lang.String transactionId)
        Adds a local Contact to the contact management system, subject to the given approval authority.
        Parameters:
        contact - The local contact
        transactionId - The transaction id of the change
        Returns:
        the addressbookUID of the created contact or null if create failed

      • retrieveContact

        Contact retrieveContact(java.lang.String abUID)
        Retrieve the contact with the given AddressBookUID from the contact management system. The retrieved contact will not include any related contacts.
        Parameters:
        abUID - The AddressBookUID
        Returns:
        The contact

      • retrieveContact

        Contact retrieveContact(java.lang.String abUID,
                        java.util.Collection<ContactBidiRel> relationships)
        Retrieve the contact with the given AddressBookUID from the contact management system, including all related contacts using the specified relationships.
        Parameters:
        abUID - The AddressBookUID
        relationships - The relationships used to get related contacts
        Returns:
        The contact

      • retrieveRelatedContacts

        Contact retrieveRelatedContacts(Contact primaryContact,
                                java.util.Collection<ContactBidiRel> relationships)
        Retrieves any related contacts for the given contact using the specified relationships.
        Parameters:
        primaryContact - The contact whose related contacts should be retrieved
        relationships - The relationships used to get related contacts
        Returns:
        The primary contact

      • searchContacts

        ContactSearchResult searchContacts(ContactSearchCriteria searchCriteria,
                                   ContactSearchFilter filter)
        Searches the contacts using the given criteria and filter. Note that the Contacts contained in the ContactSearchResult may not be complete contacts, for performance reasons, they may be just enough data for a user to select a contact from the set of search results. See the documentation for the plugin implementation for specific implementation.
        Parameters:
        searchCriteria - The search criteria
        filter - The search filter
        Returns:
        The search result

      • findDuplicates

        DuplicateSearchResult findDuplicates(Contact contact,
                                     ContactSearchFilter searchFilter)
        Finds any potential duplicates in the contact management system. Note that the Contacts contained in the DuplicateSearchResult may not be complete contacts, for performance reasons, they may be just enough data for a user to select a contact from the set of search results. See the documentation for the plugin implementation for specific implementation.
        Parameters:
        contact - The contact to find duplicates for
        searchFilter - The search filter
        Returns:
        The duplicate search result

      • retrieveDocumentsForContact

        ContactDocumentsSearchResult retrieveDocumentsForContact(java.lang.String abUID,
                                                         DocumentSearchCriteria searchCriteria,
                                                         ContactDocumentSearchFilter searchFilter)
        Finds all documents associated to the contact with the given AddressBookUID in the contact management system. Note that the documents contained in the ContactDocumentsSearchResult only include documents which are stored in the Document Management System. i.e. documents that are pending to be stored in the DMS are not included in this set of search results.
        Parameters:
        abUID - The AddressBookUID
        searchCriteria - The search criteria
        searchFilter - The search filter
        Returns:
        The documents search result

      • contactSystemSupportsDocuments

        boolean contactSystemSupportsDocuments()
        Whether documents are supported or not.
        Returns:
        true if the ContactSystem plugin integrates with Documents

      • hasSyncableChanges

        boolean hasSyncableChanges(Contact rootEntity)
        Are any of the changes on the given root entity syncable to the remote contact system? This method is used as a gating condition prior to creating a entity.Message in the rules, and can also be used within the updateContact(entity.Contact) implementation prior to communicating with the remote system.
        Parameters:
        rootEntity - The root entity being sync'd, e.g. entity.Contact
        Returns:
        true if entity has syncable changes

      • updateContact

        void updateContact(Contact contact)
        Updates the contact in the contact management system, subject to the given approval authority.
        Parameters:
        contact - The contact to update

      • updateContact

        void updateContact(Contact contact,
                   java.lang.String transactionId)
        Updates the contact in the contact management system, subject to the given approval authority.
        Parameters:
        contact - The contact to update
        transactionId - The transaction id of the change

      • createAsyncUpdate

        void createAsyncUpdate(MessageContext messageContext)
        (Potentially) creates an update message from the given message context using MessageContext.createMessage(String) within the implementation. This plugin method will be called from the "Event Fired" rules in order to generate the message with the correct payload. Implementations of this method should generate a snapshot update of the updates that need to be performed in the remote contact management system.
        Parameters:
        messageContext - The message context, whose Root will be the Contact

      • sendAsyncUpdate

        void sendAsyncUpdate(Message message,
                     java.lang.String transformedPayload)
        Sends the update message to the remote contact management system. This plugin method will be called from the ContactMessageTransport in order to process the message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent
        transformedPayload - The payload, which may have been transformed in the beforeSend()

      • getSyncableRelationshipsForContactType

        java.util.Set<ContactBidiRel> getSyncableRelationshipsForContactType(IEntityType contactType,
                                                                     boolean onlyPrimaryRelationships)
        Returns the collection of syncable relationships for a given Contact type. If onlyPrimaryRelationships is true, then only those relationships specified in the mapping files as primary relationships will be included. Otherwise all relationships that they type can have are included.
        Parameters:
        contactType -
        onlyPrimaryRelationships -
        Returns:
